verses.verse: By night <S%H3915><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> my bed <S%H4904><s%> I sought <S%H1245><s%> him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves: <S%H157><s%> I sought <S%H1245><s%> him, but I found <S%H4672><s%> him not.

I will rise <S%H6965><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> and go <S%H5437><s%> about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> in the streets, <S%H7784><s%> and in the broad <S%H7339><s%> ways <S%H7339><s%> I will seek <S%H1245><s%> him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves: <S%H157><s%> I sought <S%H1245><s%> him, but I found <S%H4672><s%> him not.

The watchmen <S%H8104><s%> that go <S%H5437><s%> about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> me: to whom I said, Saw <S%H7200><s%> you him whom <S%H853><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves? <S%H157><s%>

It was but a little <S%H4592><s%> that I passed <S%H5674><s%> from them, but I found <S%H4672><s%> him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves: <S%H157><s%> I held <S%H270><s%> him, and would not let him go, <S%H7503><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> I had brought <S%H935><s%> him into <S%H413><s%> my mother's <S%H517><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> and into <S%H413><s%> the chamber <S%H2315><s%> of her that conceived <S%H2029><s%> me.

I charge <S%H7650><s%> you, O you daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> by the roes, <S%H6643><s%> and by the hinds <S%H355><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> that you stir <S%H5782><s%> not up, nor <S%H518><s%> awake <S%H5782><s%> my love, <S%H160><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> he please. <S%H2654><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> is this <S%H2063><s%> that comes <S%H5927><s%> out of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> like pillars <S%H8490><s%> of smoke, <S%H6227><s%> perfumed <S%H6999><s%> with myrrh <S%H4753><s%> and frankincense, <S%H3828><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> powders <S%H81><s%> of the merchant? <S%H7402><s%>

Behold <S%H2009><s%> his bed, <S%H4296><s%> which is Solomon's; <S%H8010><s%> three score <S%H7657><s%> valiant <S%H1368><s%> men are about <S%H5439><s%> it, of the valiant <S%H1368><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

They all <S%H3605><s%> hold <S%H270><s%> swords, <S%H2719><s%> being expert <S%H3925><s%> in war: <S%H4421><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> has his sword <S%H2719><s%> on his thigh <S%H3409><s%> because of fear <S%H6343><s%> in the night. <S%H3915><s%>
King <S%H4428><s%> Solomon <S%H8010><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> himself a chariot <S%H668><s%> of the wood <S%H6086><s%> of Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>

He made <S%H6213><s%> the pillars <S%H5982><s%> thereof of silver, <S%H3701><s%> the bottom <S%H7507><s%> thereof of gold, <S%H2091><s%> the covering <S%H4817><s%> of it of purple, <S%H713><s%> the middle <S%H8432><s%> thereof being paved <S%H7528><s%> with love, <S%H160><s%> for the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

Go <S%H3318><s%> forth, <S%H3318><s%> O you daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Zion, <S%H6726><s%> and behold <S%H7200><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> Solomon <S%H8010><s%> with the crown <S%H5850><s%> with which his mother <S%H517><s%> crowned <S%H5849><s%> him in the day <S%H3117><s%> of his espousals, <S%H2861><s%> and in the day <S%H3117><s%> of the gladness <S%H8057><s%> of his heart. <S%H3820><s%>
